title: How much should I charge for an 1,800-word article on a technological topic? - Quora

response.answer_text: This all depends on your rate! But let’s use a common yardstick: $0.10/word is a miserable rate and $1.00/word is a “gold standard” journalism rate. This would give you a range (in USD) of between $180 and $1,800.If you charge $0.30/word, you’d already be past the $500 mark. Which of these figures you can actually command — if any — depends on your experience and on the client’s budget.

You cannot charge anything realistically. Instead you look for publicatipns that might pay for your work. You will have to accept whatever they pay. Depending on the publication that couls mean accepting anywhere from $30 to over $1000. Something on the low end of that range is realistic if you are a beginner.
